subject: Photography
title: Weather as Subject
description: A micro-lesson that makes Weather as Subject usable.

hook.text: Most people run from storms. Photographers run toward them. Weather is the most dramatic free light show.

buildup.text: Fog, storms, snow, and rain each create unique atmospheres that transform ordinary locations into extraordinary ones.

discovery.text: Fog simplifies scenes by hiding backgrounds. Snow reflects light everywhere. Storms add drama and contrast.

twist.text: Bad weather is good photography weather. Clear blue skies are actually boring â€” no texture, no mood, no story.

climax.text: Photographing weather requires gear protection and safety awareness â€” but the rewards are images no one else has.

punchline.text: Bad weather makes the best photographs. Go outside.

quiz.question: Why do photographers consider 'bad' weather good for photography?
options: It creates dramatic atmospheres, moods, and unique lighting
